page.title: 10SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The parents of children at Langtree County Primary School are worried about losing a teacher because of falling numbers of children. The farmers are concerned at a 10% cut in milk quotas, which means a cut in income. A committee has been formed to keep the Church Hall in use. House holders who have recently purchased their Council houses are disturbed that they are expected to pay to have their approach road resurfaced. The new Torridge District Council structure plan for some 50-60 houses would require a new sewer. The authorities will not provide the sewer unless the houses are built, so a state of deadlock exists.
